body: Though most ghouls hunt and kill to satiate their hunger, a huntsmaster relishes the chase as much as the feast after.
name: Ghoul Huntsmaster

sections.special_attacks: combat style (archery), disease (DC 15), favored enemy (elves +2, humans +4), paralysis (1d4+1 rounds, DC 15, elves are immune to this effect)
sections.melee: +1 bite +13 (1d6+3 plus disease and paralysis), 2 +1 claws +14 (1d8+3 plus paralysis)
sections.other_gear: mwk studded leather, mwk composite longbow with 50 arrows, 42 gp
sections.feats: Corpse Companion*, Endurance, Improved Natural Attack (claw), Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus (claw)

sections.body:
Before Combat The huntsmaster casts longstrider and uses his wand of greater magic fang on himself as well as on his animal companion.

Base Statistics Without longstrider and greater magic fang, the huntsmaster's statistics are

Speed 30 ft.

Melee bite +12 (1d6+2 plus disease and paralysis), 2 claws +13 (1d8+2 plus paralysis).
sections.name: Tactics

sections.special_qualities: favored terrain (underground +2), hunter's bond (animal), track +3, wild empathy +10
sections.name: Ghoul Huntsmaster
sections.skills: Acrobatics +13 (+17 when jumping), Climb +13, Disable Device +13, Perception +14, Stealth +16, Survival +14, Swim +9
sections.combat_gear: +1 human-bane arrows (3), +1 seeking arrows (2), potion of inflict moderate wounds, wand of greater magic fang (12 charges)

sections.senses: darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, scent; Perception +5

sections.body:
Base Statistics Without greater magic fang, the cat's statistics are

Melee bite +9 (1d4+1 plus trip), 2 claws +10 (1d2+1).
sections.name: Tactics

sections.special_qualities: tricks (attack [all creatures], come, fetch, guard, seek, stay, track)
sections.name: Corpse Cat
